column4: is gnome-screensaver running? what is your screensaver/power manager
Those settings are disabled
blackbox doesn't have any kind of screensaver. blackbox may not be notifying the screensaver that the cursor is active.
Those settings are definately disabled.
i would first figure out what screensaver is running. It could be dpms but its more likely that a screensaver just isnt realizing you are using the system because of your non-standard WM
How do I find it?
ps aux | grep saver
hmm
How do I read PS's output?
the important bit is the last column. do you see any screensaver command there?
I see grep --color=au to saver
if thats the only one then no process with "saver" in the name is running so its unlikely a screensaver is running. maybe it is dpms. you could try xset -dpms
I just need to execute that or what?
that should disable dpms. xset +dpms would reenable it
That didn't fix it.
hmmm. maybe some screensaver is running that is not named "*saver*"
http://paste.ubuntu.com/989910/
i have no idea what could be blanking your screen
Could my netbook have a hardware screensaver?
never heard of such a thing. but maybe
is it dimming going to full black, or just a dimming backlight?
Going to full black. lol
you could dig around in /sys maybe there is some acpi setting that is causing the display to turn off (or the backlight to go to zero)
